===Idiom===
{{zh-idiom}}

# high-principled; open and aboveboard; just and honorable; frank and righteous; without artifice
#* '''2006:''' 巫继学 (Wu Jixue), ''[http://www.hi.chinanews.com.cn/hnnew/2006-03-03/35602.html 光明正大的改革何拒公众参与大辩论?]'' (When conducting open and aboveboard reforms, why deny the public a chance to participate in the debate?)
#*: [[改革]][[是]][[公共]][[大众]][[的]][[事]]，[[改革]][[是]]'''光明正大'''[[的]][[事]]，[[不能]][[只]][[在]][[少数]][[精英]][[贵族]][[中]][[讨论]]，[[不能]][[静悄悄]][[地]][[进行]]，[[更]][[不能]][[在]][[那里]][[搞]][[什么]][[暗箱]][[操作]]。 (''[[Simplified Chinese|simp.]]'')
#*: [[改革]][[是]][[公共]][[大眾]][[的]][[事]]，[[改革]][[是]]'''光明正大'''[[的]][[事]]，[[不能]][[只]][[在]][[少數]][[精英]][[貴族]][[中]][[討論]]，[[不能]][[靜悄悄]][[地]][[進行]]，[[更]][[不能]][[在]][[那裡]][[搞]][[什麼]][[暗箱]][[操作]]。 (''[[Traditional Chinese|trad.]]'')
#*:: ''Reform is a public affair for the masses. Reform is an '''open and aboveboard''' affair. It should not merely be discussed among a small number of the best and brightest of the aristocracy. It should not be carried out in a "hush-hush" manner, much less behind closed doors.''
